business.headline: LG Electronics vs Tata Capital IPO: What should be your strategy post-listing?Two IPOs, two very different strategies. Tata Capital offers steady long-term growth, while LG Electronics promises quick listing gains. Read on to plan post-listing moves and investment approach carefully.

LG Electronics IPO allotment is finally out. How much listing gain you can expect?Investors who received allotments may be sitting on potential listing gains of Rs 5,000–Rs 6,000 per lot, depending on market sentiment at the time of debut.

Anil Ambani aide and senior Reliance Power executive arrested by EDThe arrest of Ashok Pal, who serves as the executive director at Reliance Power, is related to a suspected fake bank guarantee racket worth Rs 68.2 crore.

Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

The legacy of Tata Trusts, beyond the boardroomTata Trusts is one of India's oldest, largest, and most influential philanthropic foundations.  A group of public charitable trusts set up by members of the Tata family, the present-day Trusts trace their origin to the working-class-focused JN Endowment Fund, started by Jamsetji Tata.

Tata Trusts board meets today amid internal turmoil: Here's what to expectThe board meeting follows days of internal disagreement and comes just a day after the first death anniversary of Ratan N. Tata, the former chairman who led the Trusts for several decades until his death last year.

entertainment.headline: Felt like dream: Saira Banu recalls wedding with Dilip Kumar on 59th anniversary On their 59th wedding anniversary, veteran actor Saira Banu reminisced about her wedding night with late actor Dilip Kumar, calling it a dreamlike and joy-filled evening. She fondly recalled the simplicity, chaos, and heartfelt moments that made the day unforgettable.

Atlee calls new film with Allu Arjun addictive: Hollywood finds it challenging Director Atlee, said his upcoming film with Allu Arjun will be something very new, very intriguing, addictive to watch, promising a visually striking and innovative experience. Despite being the child of Bollywood superstars, Taimur is exploring his own passions at school.

Fans pull Billie Eilish into crowd during Miami concert, safely rescued by security During her Miami concert on October 9, Billie Eilish was pulled into the crowd by a fan but was quickly rescued by security and continued her performance. The incident left the singer visibly shaken, highlighting ongoing safety concerns she has faced in recent years.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Nandhini walks out after full-blown meltdown  'Bigg Boss Tamil' Season 9 contestant Nandhini exited the show after a meltdown, citing her inability to act or play along for content. Her departure left both contestants and fans emotional, with many praising her for prioritising her mental health.

Had no role: Government after women journalists barred at Taliban presserThe government clarified it had no role in the Taliban press conference in Delhi where women journalists were barred, sparking outrage over gender bias and India's image.

Pak bleeds as Islamist group's march turns violent, 11 dead in police firingThe protests by Tehreek-i-Labbaik Pakistan, which began against the killings in Gaza by Israel, turned violent as the agitators clashed with police. It paralysed life in Islamabad and Rawalpindi for a second day.

What's Tehreek-e-Labbaik, Pak army's proxy that's taken nation hostage?Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP), an extremist Islamist group, has repeatedly held Pakistan hostage through violent protests. The TLP is a proxy of the military regime and has been used by it to shape political outcomes. It held violent protests in Lahore that killed two, and forced the fortification of Islamabad.

Kantara's Divine Secret: Inside The Ancient World Of Spirit Worship ExplainerThis special report delves into the cultural phenomenon of Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara', which has cast a spotlight on the ancient Tulu traditions of coastal Karnataka. The narrative explores the deep-rooted practices of Bhuta Kola, the worship of local spirits, and the significance of the deities Panjurli and its companion, Guliga. The film showcases Bhuta Kola, which 'literally means spirit play in Tulu and it's a ritualistic performance honoring Bhutas, local spirits or deities who are believed to be protectors of the land, villages and families.' The report explains the mythology behind Panjurli, a boar spirit often associated with Lord Vishnu's Varaha avatar, seen as a powerful protector of agriculture and villages. It also touches upon other spirits within the vast Tuluva pantheon, like the fierce Guliga, the guardian Bhairava, and Kallurthi, celebrating the intricate relationship between humanity, nature, and the divine that has thrived for centuries.
